Key:
There are barely any people here. Well, I have Rio
with me, so I guess that's lucky.

(It wouldn't be great if someone ended up reporting
me to the authorities.)
Papa, how far are we going to walk?

Hm... Why don't we check this place out a bit, then
head over to Takadai. There aren't too many people
there.
Okay! Then Papa, please show me the way, okay?
Leave it to me, Princess.
Do you think Rio is a princess?

Yeah. You're as adorable as a princess, so you are a
princess.
Like how Papa's Papa?
It's a little different, but... Yeah, kind of like that.
Heeey.
...Huh? Rio, where are you?!
(Did something happen...?!)
Hehe. I've captured the princess, Shido!
She captured me.
Kaguya?! What the... What are you doing?

Hmph. Hearing you say she's a princess... I'm not
going to keep quiet about it. The princess's blood
shall resurrect my true powers―

*Cough*?! What, how dare you hurt me in this
manner... Who are you?

Gosh. You've gone too far, involving a child in your
antics.
Kurumi?! You dare get in my way?!
K-Kurumi... What are you doing here?

It seemed like Kaguya-san was playing around, so I
came to rescue you. Is that a problem?

Well, I don't know exactly what's going on, but... I
guess you saved us?
Oh? I don't know.

*Grunt*... How dare you get in the way of my holy
ritual... I was just planning to have some fun with
her...

Your definition of fun is unsettling. You need to
study a bit more.

Hmph. So... My servant Shido. Who is that? Is she
really your pretty, pretty princess?

What is up with that name... She's Rio. Uh...
Tonomachi's relative.

I see, I get it now! So the last hope that your eternal
friend has left you! That is her true nature, is it?
Uh, what do you mean by true nature?

(She's not really related to him, and Tonomachi isn't
my eternal friend.)
Hmm... Rio is a pretty, pretty princess?
Yes, you are a very adorable princess.
Hehe... Thank you for saying nice things, Kurumin.
Hauu?!
Wh-What the?! Kurumi is acting odd...
You really are adorable. What is your name, nya?
Nya? I just felt shivers down my spine...
Wh-What is your name?
I'm Rio, Kurumin.

Then Rio-san, please tell me one thing. Why are you
calling me Kurumin?
Kurumin is Kurumin, right? A pretty kitty, right?
I don't quite understand, but my heart hurts.

It's so rare to see Kurumi being attacked one-sided.
Hehe... I've witnessed something interesting today.
Haha... Yeah.

(I think Rio heard from Marina what happened in the
virtual world. That's why it makes sense that Kurumi
wouldn't remember.)
Anyways, small child―Do you know my name?
Kaguya-chan.
Grr... That's not it―my true name!
Hmm... Ka-chan?
I'm not at that age!
Hm... Hehehehe.
Pfft... Hahahahahaha!

(I guess both Kurumi and I couldn't handle Rio's
sudden statement.)

(After that, Kurumi hugged Rio, and Kaguya and Rio
played pretend... Before we knew it, it was evening.)
Rio has to go soon.
Oh, is it time to see Marina?
Yeah. I promised her.
I see. Did you have fun?
Yes. I had a lot of fun.
Okay, good.
Well... Bye, Papa, Kurumin, Kaguya-chan.
Yes, I am satisfied.

Be careful when saying my name in front
of other people, Rio, my underling.

Okay, Kaguya-chan. I'll be sure to not call you Ka-
chan.
Like I said—!
Haha... Kaguya, say goodbye.
Okay. Later, Rio.
Later, Rio.
Okay! Later! Goodbye!

(...Hey wait. I had something to ask Marina and I totally
forgot. Oh well, next time I see her―)
I forgot to tell you something, Papa.
Hm? What is it?
If you're going to visit today... Park, okay?
(Rio whispered into my ear.)
...Okay.
Bye-bye!
My, a secret with Shido-san?

No... She just said thanks for today. I'm glad she had
fun.
(I couldn't tell her what Rio told me.)

Right. Though I feel like there was one bad influence
here.
Hey, are you talking about me?!

Oh, so you knew. It doesn't look like you feel bad
about it at all.

Hmph. You're of a similar breed, so you shouldn't be
talking!
A-A similar breed? To... whom?
To me.

What... He...hehehee... Seems like we played too much.
I'm going to excuse myself now.
Huh? She's gone already?
Oh, Kurumi must have been shocked.
(I couldn't help but give a wry smile.)
